page.title: 20THE FUTURE- CONCLUSION
page.content: The future plans for the village do not allow for great growth. One estate of private houses is planned;one more block of Old Peoples housing is planned.Other development will be infill.Industrial development already under way should maintain the present low figure of unemployment.Development of social facilities is needed because the largest hall seats only 100 people. Earls Barton presents a well balanced community of mainly owner-occupiers with ambition as the numbers enrolling at the Adult Education classes shows. It has a large nucleus of younger families with mobility.The proposed rail development at Wellingborough will continue to make this village an attractive place to live in.
